intro: Leptosiphon chrysanthus subsp. decorus, commonly known as the golden beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. The subspecies decorus is distinguished by its more ornamental appearance compared to other members of the species.
